title: Intro to lavaanPlot
text: lavaan package excellent package structural equation models, DiagrammeR package excellent package producing nice looking graph diagrams. right now, lavaan package built plotting functions models, available options external packages don’t look nice aren’t easy use DiagrammeR, opinion. course, can use DiagrammeR build path diagrams models, requires build diagram specification manually. package exists streamline process, allowing plot lavaan models directly, without translate DOT language specification DiagrammeR uses.

title: Intro to lavaanPlot
text: package straightforward use, simply call lavaanPlot function lavaan model, adding whatever graph, node edge attributes want named list (graph attributes specified standard default value shows attribute lists look like). reference, available attributes can found : http://rich-iannone.github.io/DiagrammeR/graphviz_and_mermaid.html#node-attributes http://rich-iannone.github.io/DiagrammeR/graphviz_and_mermaid.html#edge-attributes ’s quick example using mtcars data set. First fit lavaan model. package supports plotting lavaan regression relationships latent variable - indicator relationships. using model fit object, simply call lavaanPlot function, specifying desired graph parameters.
code: library(lavaan) ## This is lavaan 0.6-11 ## lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. library(lavaanPlot)  model <- 'mpg ~ cyl + disp + hp           qsec ~ disp + hp + wt'  fit <- sem(model, data = mtcars) summary(fit) ## lavaan 0.6-11 ended normally after 32 iterations ##  ##   Estimator                                         ML ##   Optimization method                           NLMINB ##   Number of model parameters                         9 ##                                                        ##   Number of observations                            32 ##                                                        ## Model Test User Model: ##                                                        ##   Test statistic                                18.266 ##   Degrees of freedom                                 2 ##   P-value (Chi-square)                           0.000 ##  ## Parameter Estimates: ##  ##   Standard errors                             Standard ##   Information                                 Expected ##   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured ##  ## Regressions: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##   mpg ~                                                 ##     cyl               -0.987    0.738   -1.337    0.181 ##     disp              -0.021    0.010   -2.178    0.029 ##     hp                -0.017    0.014   -1.218    0.223 ##   qsec ~                                                ##     disp              -0.008    0.004   -2.122    0.034 ##     hp                -0.023    0.004   -5.229    0.000 ##     wt                 1.695    0.398    4.256    0.000 ##  ## Covariances: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##  .mpg ~~                                                ##    .qsec               0.447    0.511    0.874    0.382 ##  ## Variances: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##    .mpg                8.194    2.049    4.000    0.000 ##    .qsec               0.996    0.249    4.000    0.000 lavaanPlot(model = fit, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = FALSE)

title: Intro to lavaanPlot
text: can also specify different variable labels using named list labels argument. example showing latent variable relationships: can label plot edges coefficient values using coefs = TRUE. default show paths, can also specify whatever significance level want using sig argument show significant paths. can also show standardized paths stand argument. works latent variable loadings can also include double-sided edges represent model covariances want: can include significance stars well using stars option. can choose stars regression paths, latent paths, covariances. Specify 3 want (“regress”, “latent”, “covs”). can change number decimal places coefficient value labels well digits option.
code: labels <- list(mpg = "Miles Per Gallon", cyl = "Cylinders", disp = "Displacement", hp = "Horsepower", qsec = "Speed", wt = "Weight")  lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = FALSE) HS.model <- ' visual  =~ x1 + x2 + x3       textual =~ x4 + x5 + x6 speed   =~ x7 + x8 + x9  '  fit <- cfa(HS.model, data=HolzingerSwineford1939)  lavaanPlot(model = fit, edge_options = list(color = "grey")) model <- 'mpg ~ cyl + disp + hp           qsec ~ disp + hp + wt'  fit <- sem(model, data = mtcars) summary(fit) ## lavaan 0.6-11 ended normally after 32 iterations ##  ##   Estimator                                         ML ##   Optimization method                           NLMINB ##   Number of model parameters                         9 ##                                                        ##   Number of observations                            32 ##                                                        ## Model Test User Model: ##                                                        ##   Test statistic                                18.266 ##   Degrees of freedom                                 2 ##   P-value (Chi-square)                           0.000 ##  ## Parameter Estimates: ##  ##   Standard errors                             Standard ##   Information                                 Expected ##   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured ##  ## Regressions: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##   mpg ~                                                 ##     cyl               -0.987    0.738   -1.337    0.181 ##     disp              -0.021    0.010   -2.178    0.029 ##     hp                -0.017    0.014   -1.218    0.223 ##   qsec ~                                                ##     disp              -0.008    0.004   -2.122    0.034 ##     hp                -0.023    0.004   -5.229    0.000 ##     wt                 1.695    0.398    4.256    0.000 ##  ## Covariances: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##  .mpg ~~                                                ##    .qsec               0.447    0.511    0.874    0.382 ##  ## Variances: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##    .mpg                8.194    2.049    4.000    0.000 ##    .qsec               0.996    0.249    4.000    0.000 lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE) # significant standardized paths only lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, sig = .05) # All paths unstandardized lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, stand = TRUE) HS.model <- ' visual  =~ x1 + x2 + x3       textual =~ x4 + x5 + x6 speed   =~ x7 + x8 + x9  '  fit <- cfa(HS.model, data=HolzingerSwineford1939)  labels = list(visual = "Visual Ability", textual = "Textual Ability", speed = "Speed Ability")  # Show coefs lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE) # Significant paths lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, sig = .05) # All paths standardized lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, stand = TRUE) HS.model <- ' visual  =~ x1 + x2 + x3       textual =~ x4 + x5 + x6 speed   =~ x7 + x8 + x9  '  fit <- cfa(HS.model, data=HolzingerSwineford1939)  labels = list(visual = "Visual Ability", textual = "Textual Ability", speed = "Speed Ability")  # significant standardized paths only lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE) lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = "covs") lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = "latent") lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = TRUE, digits = 1)

title: Intro to lavaanPlot
text: can also additional options modify layout plots certain ways. graph option rankdir allows change overall orientation plot TB (top-bottom; default), BT (bottom-top), RL (right-left) LR (left-right):
code: lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, graph_options = list(rankdir = "LR"), node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = TRUE, digits = 1) lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, graph_options = list(rankdir = "RL"), node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = TRUE, digits = 1) lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, graph_options = list(rankdir = "BT"), node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = TRUE, digits = 1)

title: Intro to lavaanPlot
text: graph option layout allows change layout engine used generate plot dot (default), neato, circo, twopi, plus others, see: https://graphviz.org/docs/layouts/. mileage may vary whether work given graph.
code: lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, graph_options = list(layout = "neato"), node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = TRUE, digits = 1) lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, graph_options = list(layout = "circo"), node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = TRUE, digits = 1) lavaanPlot(model = fit, labels = labels, graph_options = list(layout = "twopi"), node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = TRUE, covs = TRUE, stars = TRUE, digits = 1)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Alex Lishinski. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lishinski (2022). lavaanPlot: Path Diagrams 'Lavaan' Models via 'DiagrammeR'. https://github.com/alishinski/lavaanPlot, https://lavaanplot.alexlishinski.com/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {lavaanPlot: Path Diagrams for 'Lavaan' Models via 'DiagrammeR'},   author = {Alex Lishinski},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/alishinski/lavaanPlot, https://lavaanplot.alexlishinski.com/}, }

text: can install lavaanPlot CRAN : can also install development version lavaanPlot GitHub :
code: install.packages("lavaanPlot") install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("alishinski/lavaanPlot")

title: Path Diagrams for Lavaan Models via DiagrammeR
text: ’s quick example using mtcars data set. First fit lavaan model. package supports plotting lavaan regression relationships latent variable - indicator relationships. using model fit object, simply call lavaanPlot function, specifying desired graph parameters.  also functionality save plots images embed pdf output documents.
code: library(lavaan) ## This is lavaan 0.6-10 ## lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. library(lavaanPlot)  model <- 'mpg ~ cyl + disp + hp           qsec ~ disp + hp + wt'  fit <- sem(model, data = mtcars) summary(fit) ## lavaan 0.6-10 ended normally after 32 iterations ##  ##   Estimator                                         ML ##   Optimization method                           NLMINB ##   Number of model parameters                         9 ##                                                        ##   Number of observations                            32 ##                                                        ## Model Test User Model: ##                                                        ##   Test statistic                                18.266 ##   Degrees of freedom                                 2 ##   P-value (Chi-square)                           0.000 ##  ## Parameter Estimates: ##  ##   Standard errors                             Standard ##   Information                                 Expected ##   Information saturated (h1) model          Structured ##  ## Regressions: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##   mpg ~                                                 ##     cyl               -0.987    0.738   -1.337    0.181 ##     disp              -0.021    0.010   -2.178    0.029 ##     hp                -0.017    0.014   -1.218    0.223 ##   qsec ~                                                ##     disp              -0.008    0.004   -2.122    0.034 ##     hp                -0.023    0.004   -5.229    0.000 ##     wt                 1.695    0.398    4.256    0.000 ##  ## Covariances: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##  .mpg ~~                                                ##    .qsec               0.447    0.511    0.874    0.382 ##  ## Variances: ##                    Estimate   Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) ##    .mpg                8.194    2.049    4.000    0.000 ##    .qsec               0.996    0.249    4.000    0.000 lavaanPlot(model = fit, node_options = list(shape = "box", fontname = "Helvetica"), edge_options = list(color = "grey"), coefs = F) model <- 'mpg ~ cyl + disp + hp           qsec ~ disp + hp + wt'  fit <- sem(model, data = mtcars)  pl <- lavaanPlot(model = fit)  # Example for pdf embed embed_plot_pdf(pl, "plot2.pdf")  # Example for saving to .png save_png(pl, "plot.png")

title: Builds the Diagrammer function call. — buildCall
code: buildCall(   model = model,   name = name,   labels = labels,   graph_options = list(overlap = "true", fontsize = "10"),   node_options = list(shape = "box"),   edge_options = list(color = "black"),   ... )

title: Builds the Diagrammer function call. — buildCall
text: model model fit object class lavaan. name string name plot. labels optional named list variable labels fit object class lavaan. graph_options named list graph options Diagrammer syntax. node_options named list node options Diagrammer syntax. edge_options named list edge options Diagrammer syntax. ... additional arguments passed buildPaths

code: buildPaths(   fit,   coefs = FALSE,   sig = 1,   stand = FALSE,   covs = FALSE,   stars = NULL,   digits = 2 )

title: Extracts the paths from the lavaan model. — buildPaths
text: fit model fit object class lavaan. coefs whether include significant path coefficient values diagram sig significance level determining significant paths stand coefficients used standardized coefficients covs model covariances included diagram stars character vector indicating parameters include significance stars included regression paths, latent paths, covariances. Include 3 want ("regress", "latent", "covs"), default none. digits number indicating desired number digits coefficient values plot

title: Embeds a plot into an rmarkdown pdf — embed_plot_pdf
code: library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-11 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs. model <- 'mpg ~ cyl + disp + hp           qsec ~ disp + hp + wt' fit <- sem(model, data = mtcars) pl <- lavaanPlot(model = fit) if (FALSE) { embed_plot_pdf(pl, "plot2.pdf") }

code: library(lavaan) model <- 'mpg ~ cyl + disp + hp           qsec ~ disp + hp + wt' fit <- sem(model, data = mtcars) pl <- lavaanPlot(model = fit) if (FALSE) { save_png(pl, "plot.png") }

title: lavaanPlot 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-01-26 Added support latent variables (denoted circles) plots Added support edge labels significant coefficients

title: lavaanPlot 0.4.0
text: Added support latent variable loading labels Added support covariance edges Corrected direction arrows latent variable loadings

title: lavaanPlot 0.5.0
text: Added support covariance edge labels Added support significance stars

title: lavaanPlot 0.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-04-25 Fixed bug caused . variable names simplified functions using … argument fixed significance stars work standardized non-standardized coefficients Changed significance stars can choose parameters use

title: lavaanPlot 0.5.2
text: Added digits option coefficients Changed coefs argument behavior toggles coef values covariances Plots now show residual covariances

title: lavaanPlot 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-03 added functions save plots images embed plots pdfs Rmarkdown

title: lavaanPlot 0.6.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-13 Fixed issues suggested packages causing trouble CRAN submission

title: lavaanPlot 0.6.3
text: Added support specifying dimensions saved png files Updated vignette layout graph options Added package tests

title: lavaanPlot 0.7.0
text: Introducing lavaanPlot2 function, replicates old functionality flexible platform
